name: Seth Meyers
monologue: The U.S. on Saturday launched strikes against three Iranian nuclear sites in a surprise attack. Well, surprise to everyone who’s not on Pete Hegseth’s text chain.

name: Seth Meyers
monologue: Vice President J.D. Vance defended President Trump’s decision to launch air strikes against Iranian nuclear sites and said, ‘We do not want war with Iran. We actually want peace.’ I don’t know, man, I think what you might actually want is a dictionary.

name: Seth Meyers
monologue: MIGA [Trump’s acronym for ‘Make Iran Great Again’] sounds like how a 14-year-old valley girl reacts when her boyfriend dumps her. Seth Meyers

name: Seth Meyers
monologue: He’s talking to God the way you FaceTime with your parents. ‘Hi God! We love you! Love you God! Can you see the Eiffel Tower behind us?'

name: Seth Meyers
monologue: It’s like if you asked a goth teen what he thinks goes on in church. ‘I don’t know, they’re probably all like, we just wanna say we love you, God, or something. Sheep.'

name: Seth Meyers
monologue: New York Governor Kathy Hochul yesterday declared a state of emergency amid a heat wave that’s expected to break 125-year-old records, which means it’s time for my favorite hobby—going down to Times Square to watch the Elmos faint.

name: Seth Meyers
monologue: Sonic Drive-In has announced it will offer a Pickle Rita slush made with a pickle juice flavored boba after asking themselves, ‘What is the absolute worst thing you could spill in your car.’

name: Seth Meyers
monologue: The CEO of the messaging app Telegram said in a recent interview that his multibillion dollar fortune will be left to the six children he has with three different partners and the more than 100 children conceived through sperm donation. And I just have to say, it’s refreshing to see a billionaire who knows how many kids he has.

name: Stephen Colbert
monologue: The planes were carrying 30,000-pound bombs, known as ‘Bunker Busters,’ officially called ‘MOPs,’ or ‘Massive Ordnance Penetrators.’ The most phallic-sounding weapon since the Tomahawk Cruise Schvantz.

name: Stephen Colbert
monologue: MIGA? MIGA? Your whole damn thing is America First! You can’t just hand other countries your slogan! That’s like if McDonald’s had an ad campaign that said ‘I’m Lovin’ It. It being Burger King.’

name: Stephen Colbert
monologue: Thank you, you brave souls, for waiting outside in the humidity that the Weather Channel described as ‘The devil’s trouser chili.’

name: Stephen Colbert
monologue: Nope. Nope. That’s not how it works. ‘Honey! I’m not cheating on you with Stacy! I’m cheating on you with parts of Stacy. Very selective. And yes. And yes, we do call it Operation Midnight Hammer.’

name: Jimmy Fallon
monologue: The strike on Iran was called ‘Operation Midnight Hammer.’ Yeah, it was named after Trump’s favorite Stormy Daniels movie.

name: Jimmy Fallon
monologue: Iran is now threatening to retaliate by closing a major waterway for oil exports called the Strait of Hormuz. Yeah. Even worse, Trump thinks Hormuz is a brand of chili.

name: Jimmy Fallon
monologue: Trump hasn’t thanked God since he once counted 11 McNuggets in his 10-piece. ‘Oh, my — thank you, God! You visit me in mysterious ways, you do.’

name: Jimmy Fallon
monologue: It’s not wearing a suit that makes me feel sticky. It’s the two layers of Spanx underneath it.

name: Jimmy Fallon
monologue: Seriously, it is brutal out there. You know it’s bad when the heat map looks like Elmo’s colonoscopy.

name: Jimmy Fallon
monologue: Now? No, no, no. Maybe in the wintertime, maybe. Not when it’s warm. No, no, no.

name: Jimmy Fallon
monologue: More than 16 billion passwords for Google, Apple, Facebook, and other platforms have been leaked in one of the largest hacks of all time. Now everyone knows your Facebook password but you.’

name: Jimmy Fallon
monologue: Tomorrow Jeff Bezos and Lauren Sanchez kick off their three-day wedding celebration in Venice. You know you’re powerful when you have your destination wedding on a Tuesday and people still show up.

name: Jimmy Kimmel
monologue: I’ve never hosted a talk show before, but I will try my best. English is not my first language. So I hope you guys will help me if I get — what’s the word? Deported.
